question: Suppose that the equilibrium price of an article is N5.00 but the government fixes the price by law at N4.00, the supply will be
explanation: If the market price is below the equilibrium price, quantity supplied is less than quantity demanded, creating a shortage. The market is not clear. It is in shortage. Market price will rise because of this shortage.

question: A budget deficit means
options: That a country is buying more than is selling
That a country is selling more than is buying
That a government is spending more than in takes in taxation
That a government is spending less than it takes in taxation
That a government is spending as much as it takes in taxation

question: When elasticity is zero, the demand curve is
explanation: If the price elasticity of demand is zero, it means that the demand is totally independent of the price. No matter how the price changes, people buy the same quantity of the product. The demand curve of essential commodities like medicines has a slope which approaches zero. The demand curve will be perfectly inelastic.

question: The following is NOT a reason for the existence of small firms
options: Scale of production is limited by size of the market
Large firms can carter for wide markets
Small firms can provide personal services

question: Inferior goods are referred to in Economics as goods
explanation: In economics, an inferior good is a good whose demand decreases when consumer income rises (or demand increases when consumer income decreases)
options: Whose consumption falls when cunsumers' income rises
Which satisfy only the basic needs

question: Malthus became famous through his theory which may be stated simply
explanation: Malthus theory states that population growth will always tend to outrun the food supply and that betterment of humankind is impossible without strict limits on reproduction

population may outgrow the means of subsistence
people will eventually decide not to have children
migration of people from one place to another may leave some parts of the world barren

question: A commercial bank is unique in that it is the only institution that
explanation: The most distinctive features of a commercial bank are borrowing and lending, i.e., acceptance of deposits and lending of money to projects to earn Interest (profit).
options: makes loans to private people and businessmen
can transfer money from one place to another for its customers
saves money through the granting of credits
